provided_toolkits.name: TestAutomationCodeAnalysisToolkit
provided_toolkits.description: This ToolKit provides tools for indexing the source code of provided repository and set of methods to get insights of the code and code snippets.

branch.description: Branch to checkout, defaults to master
branch.title: Branch

api_url.description: Link to git repository with codebase for analysis
api_url.title: Repository Link

access_token.description: Git access token with appropriate scopes for repository read access
access_token.title: Token

provided_tools.name: create_datasource
provided_tools.description: Creates a new datasource by indexing a Git repository for code analysis. The indexing process extracts code structure, dependencies, and other metadata to enable subsequent queries.

exclude_files.description: List of comma-separated gitignore-style patterns for files to exclude. Applied after include_files.
exclude_files.title: Exclude Files

include_files.description: List of comma-separated gtignore-style patterns for files to include. If specified, only matching files are kept.
include_files.title: Include Files

datasource_root.description: Root directory in the datasource to be analyzed
datasource_root.title: Root Directory

provided_tools.name: get_outgoing_dependencies
provided_tools.description: Analyzes and returns information about external dependencies and imports used by specified files or code components, helping to understand code relationships and dependency chains.

end_line.description: Ending line number to get outgoing dependencies till, defaults to end of file
end_line.title: End Line

file_path.description: Path of the file to get outgoing dependencies from
file_path.title: Relative Path

start_line.description: Starting line number to get outgoing dependencies from, defaults to 1
start_line.title: Start Line

provided_tools.name: get_datasource
provided_tools.description: Get information about an existing datasource.

provided_tools.name: reindex_datasource
provided_tools.description: Updates an existing datasource by re-indexing the associated Git repository to incorporate the latest changes and maintain synchronization with the current codebase.

provided_tools.name: delete_datasource
provided_tools.description: Removes an existing datasource and all its indexed data from the system, freeing up resources and cleaning up stale references.

provided_tools.name: get_files_tree
provided_tools.description: Retrieves a hierarchical representation of the file system structure of the indexed repository, showing directories and files in a tree format for easy navigation.

path.description: Relative path within the repository to start the tree structure from
path.title: Relative Path

level.description: Maximum depth of the tree structure, defaults to full depth
level.title: Level

limit.description: Maximum number of files to include in the tree structure, defaults to all files
limit.title: Limit

provided_tools.name: get_files_list
provided_tools.description: Retrieves a list of files and directories within the specified path in the indexed repository, showing file names and types for easy reference.

path.description: Relative path within the repository to list files from
path.title: Relative Path

limit.description: Maximum number of files to include in the list, defaults to all files
limit.title: Limit

recursive.description: Flag to include files recursively, defaults to false
recursive.title: Recursive

provided_tools.name: get_trimmed_code
provided_tools.description: Retrieves a simplified version of code from specified files with non-essential elements (like comments and some whitespace) removed to focus on the core functionality.

file_path.description: Path of the file to extract trimmed code from
file_path.title: Relative Path

exclude_private.description: Flag to exclude private members from the trimmed code, defaults to true
exclude_private.title: Exclude Private

show_line_numbers.description: Flag to include line numbers in the trimmed code, defaults to false
show_line_numbers.title: Show Line Numbers

provided_tools.name: get_metadata
provided_tools.description: Retrieves metadata information about specified files in the indexed repository, including file size, line count, and other relevant details.

file_path.description: Relative path to the file to get metadata for
file_path.title: Relative Path

provided_tools.name: unload_datasource
provided_tools.description: Unloads (detaches) an existing datasource from in-memory cache without deleting persisted metadata or files. Use this to free RAM when a datasource is idle; it can be lazily reloaded later on demand.

provided_tools.name: get_code_members
provided_tools.description: Get the code members (functions, classes, etc.) from a specific file.

end_line.description: Ending line number to extract code members till, defaults to end of file
end_line.title: End Line

file_path.description: Path of the file to extract code members from
file_path.title: Relative Path

start_line.description: Starting line number to extract code members from, defaults to 1
start_line.title: Start Line

provided_tools.name: get_code
provided_tools.description: Fetches the complete, unmodified source code of specified files or code segments from the indexed repository, preserving all original formatting and comments.

end_line.description: Ending line number to extract code till, defaults to end of file
end_line.title: End Line

file_path.description: Path of the file to extract code from
file_path.title: Relative Path

start_line.description: Starting line number to extract code from, defaults to 1
start_line.title: Start Line

show_line_numbers.description: Flag to include line numbers in the code, defaults to false
show_line_numbers.title: Show Line Numbers
